title: Agent Configuration Schema
description: Schema for configuring Amazon Q Developer CLI agents

description.description: A description of the agent's purpose

prompt.description: The system prompt that defines the agent's behavior and capabilities

mcpServers.description: Configuration for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers

command.description: The command to run the MCP server

args.description: Arguments to pass to the MCP server command

propertyNames.description: The names of the mcp server

oneOf.description: A list of mcp server to include from the global mcp.json. Supports globbing on the server names.

items.description: Name of mcp server from global mcp.json

tools.description: List of tools the agent can see. Use "@{MCP_SERVER_NAME}/tool_name" to specify tools from mcp servers. To include all tools from a server, use "@{MCP_SERVER_NAME}"

alias.description: Tool aliases for remapping tool names

additionalProperties.description: The name to change to. For tools in mcp servers, you would need to exclude their server prefix

propertyNames.type: Subject of the tool name change. For tools in mcp servers, you would need to prefix them with their server names

allowedTools.description: List of tools the agent is explicitly allowed to use

includedFiles.description: Files to include in the agent's context

createHooks.description: Commands to run when a chat session is created

oneOf.description: Object mapping hook names to command strings

additionalProperties.description: The command string to execute for this hook

promptHooks.description: Commands to run before processing each prompt

oneOf.description: Array of command to execute before each prompt
Object mapping hook names to command strings for prompt processing

additionalProperties.description: The command string to execute for this prompt hook

propertyNames.description: The name/identifier for this prompt hook

toolsSettings.description: Settings for specific tools. These are mostly for native tools. The actual schema differs by tools and is documented in detail in our documentation

properNames.description: The name of the tool to be configured
